response:

<<<code>>>: $CODE

Question: Split the number on a decimal: :How to delete all the character/ number after the . in a stringString i = "154.232";I just want 154Thanks My Code:distance = crntLocation.distanceTo(newLocation)/1000; // in kmdouble newKB = Math.floor(distance);String product_distance = String.valueOf(newKB);    product_distance.replaceAll("\\..*", "");
Please using this api: StringTokenizer.nextToken.
Answer: <<<api>>>: StringTokenizer
<<<code>>>: 
StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(i, ".");
String result = st.nextToken();

<<<explanation>>>: The StringTokenizer class is used to break a string into tokens. In this case, we are using it to break the string i into two tokens at the decimal point. The first token is the integer part of the number, and the second token is the decimal part. We only want the integer part, so we use nextToken() to get that.

The result will be stored in the variable result.

Please note that this code will not work if there are multiple decimal points in the string. If you have a string like "154.232.345", it will only return "154".

Also, this code will not work if the string does not contain a decimal point. If you have a string like "154", it will return the same string.

If you want to handle these cases, you will need to add additional code to check if the string contains a decimal point before trying to split it.
